website_summaries.verdict: This is the latest bike computer from Garmin. The large screen is responsive, but the software can be glitchy.
pros: The high resolution, responsive touchscreen displays ride information and metrics, like VO2 max, recommended recovery time, and more
It can also display smartphone notifications when connected wirelessly, as well as weather info
cons: Some glitches to the newer software that need to be worked out

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this device after a miserable experience with the Edge 1000 Unfortunately it suffers from all the same problems: battery life is nothing like advertised, it simply will not connect to my iphone without spending 15 minutes and multiple tries, rides do not upload without I'd say 10x tries, dropping .fit files into the device for courses from RWGPS does not work as advertised, the connectivity with Strava and RWGPS always errors out, it constantly says you are off course during a route, many of the data screens are confusing All in all it sucks on just about every front a real cyclist wants and is a total waste of money Get the Wahoo Roam
customer_reviews.author: Joseph and Anne Henley Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Big Speed Upgrade to the 820
customer_reviews.text: I moved to this as soon as it was released since I was growing weary of the touchscreen and speed of the 820. It is a big step up and the slight size increase is welcome. I also like the more positive opening/closing of the USB door for charging.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: It stopped working after 2 weeks ....
customer_reviews.text: So the features themselves were nice, when it worked, but unfortunately it stopped working after only 2 trips .... One thing I didn't like was the fact that it required a phone connection to be able to show the maps and my phone couldn't connect to it, because Garmin was hacked at the time, so half the features weren't working. I was expecting this to be an autonomous unit and not dependent on phone ....
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller size unit looks better and is readable in all light conditions. Works the best for me.
customer_reviews.text: Best option. Sensors work and integrate with my Samsung 10+ Garmin app. Yeti sb100 custom build all T3 carbon frame, axs wireless drive, drop post, upgraded wheels and rims. Carbon water bottle frame and Camelback bottle. Check out my pics. Hope this helps, this model is highly recommended over the huge screen model and honesty, it's too big.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Goff

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: this is my first bike computer but so far i'm loving it. easy to pair to your phone as well as satellites as long as you are outside. the touch screen is responsive and the course creation functions and software are intuitive and easy to use. battery life seems good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Toothdoc

customer_reviews.title: Best Garmin Yet.
customer_reviews.text: The 830 is superior to other Garmin units I own which include the 520, 530, 820 and 1000. The touch screen on the 830 is as good as a cell phone phone which couldn’t be said for the 820 model. Start-up is fast and doesn’t leave you wondering if it is really going to happen. Battery life - This is probably the biggest surprise of all. I was on a 9 hr 102 mile fat bike excursion using navigation and only used 43% of the battery. Nice work Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Voelker

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: Use for mostly power based training with power meter and AXS integration, ride tracking, heart rate data, distance, elevation etc. Tons of features like starred strava segment pop ups, real time climb data with graphics, pop up segment tracking against best time, interval training lap data etc. Lots of screen choices-up to 10 data points. Not touch screen so you need to familiarize yourself with navigation the various menus to get to what you need.
customer_reviews.author: jon brian sant

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first actual bike computer. The real time info on cadence and heart rate is making me a stronger rider. Battery life is stellar. I charge it after every ride and rarely use more than 25%, even after a 4-5 hour ride. Accuracy seems to be great. Elevation gain is sometimes a little iffy, but that's normal with any consumer GPS device from my experience. The touch screen I gave 4 stars. For the most part it works fine but sometimes can be a little glitchy, but not bad. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David K

customer_reviews.title: Locks up once a month
customer_reviews.text: I xant give this 5 stars because it looks up when booting every few weeks. I have to do a reset to get it to work and wait for it to download everything before it is ready. This is really annoying when I am dressed, hop on the bike in a rush to get my ride in, but am held up because the unit is not functioning.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan A Hutzler

customer_reviews.title: Garmin Edge 830 performs!
customer_reviews.text: I'll leave the reviews to the professional reviewers. I just ride and I want the data without excessive hassle. Edge 830 solves/addresses and eliminated the problems I was having with my Edge 510. The 510 performed great for several years, but problems crept in. After looking over all makes and models, I stayed with Garmin. I have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Underwood

customer_reviews.title: Software terrible
customer_reviews.text: These guys clearly can’t do software - syncing workouts is a pain in the neck. It works, until it doesn’t. And the usual ways of getting it to work (unsync, turn off both devices and any permissions of these prehistoric animals primitive actions) don’t work. Contemplating returning precisely because of an expensive cycling computer like this should not put users through this.
customer_reviews.author: Semir

customer_reviews.title: very accurate
customer_reviews.text: I use this to track my cycling routes/miles and hiking and I really love this computer. There's not much instructional and learning how to run it though but there are videos online that helped me.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Socea

customer_reviews.title: Must have to keep track of your activities
customer_reviews.text: Have been using it for a while and just love it. Always connects and maintains connection to my phone on the rides, and displays notifications like incoming calls or text messeges. All the functions are easy to use and intuitive. Good battery life and just compliments the bike well. Automatically syncs with strava.
customer_reviews.author: Julius G.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product, great upgrade from the 530
customer_reviews.text: Terrific Garmin quality, had a 530, gave it to my son so I could move up to the touchscreen 830. Good visibility in bright sunshine, pairs perfectly with my FR235 for HR and Strava.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this computer to replace my Garmin 800. I like that it connects via Bluetooth to my iPhone so that the activity transmits to Garmin Connect as soon as I’m done. The only thing I would like is for the forward and back arrows to be displayed all the time. Garmin does have a remote that does the same as the arrows but I’m running out of handlebar space. The 830 is a great computer. Lots of options and info from those options.
customer_reviews.author: Th

customer_reviews.title: A must have for all serious cyclists
customer_reviews.text: It Garmin is fairly easy to set up. Extremely accurate with it's calculations for distance and speed. A must have for all serious cyclists.
customer_reviews.author: SusanTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Screen glare, bad software, pricey
customer_reviews.text: Tried to “upgrade” from my 520. Will not work with Strava unless you’re running the garmin app on your phone in the background. The screen glare outdoors is unbearable. The hardware is nice but the Software needs miles of improvement. Got a wahoo and haven’t looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Omar P

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: It integrated Seamlessly with my bike and the various sensors I use. Really enjoy using it!
customer_reviews.author: Stitch

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect........ some connectivity issues.
customer_reviews.text: This being my first cycling computer, I’ve nothing to compare with, but this unit has provided me with all of the data I could want. There’s a high level of customization and the interface is pretty intuitive. My one gripe is that the Bluetooth connection with a phone can be spotty at times, which caused the initial setup to be a bit needlessly difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Joseph Fogle

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I decided to do an update. I think this is a good option, fast, improved interface, improved sensor, improved display and much more powerful battery. I will recommend.
customer_reviews.author: joan

customer_reviews.title: Good GPS at a low cost.
customer_reviews.text: Great small GPS at a good price point. Much better than pulling out the cell phone at every turn to stay on track. GPS is pretty accurate but does drop out on occasion.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Daugirda

customer_reviews.title: Terrible connecting to phone and Cadence not pairing to unit
customer_reviews.text: Terrible connecting to phone and Cadence not pairing to unit. Hopefully this was a bad unit. Sending it back for a replacement. So I hope the new one works properly.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar Cacatian

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: As advertised, solid product, great functionality. Sweaty fingers on touch screen never a great combo on any headset...
customer_reviews.author: Stokes

customer_reviews.title: 830 vs 820
customer_reviews.text: Has proved an improvement to the 820 I had previously
customer_reviews.author: Henry Seah

customer_reviews.title: Solid performing cycle computer.
customer_reviews.text: My previous Edge 510 was lost. This is a greater upgrade while maintaining all that was good in the previous device.
customer_reviews.author: Omar St A. Downie

customer_reviews.title: Best Garmin yet!
customer_reviews.text: After owning different Garmin for 15 years this is a leap into the best technology available.
customer_reviews.author: Carmelo Herrero

customer_reviews.title: Good cycling computer
customer_reviews.text: There was a bit of a learning curve but one I figured it out, I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Lockhart

customer_reviews.title: Complicated and somewhat unpredictable
customer_reviews.text: On the one hand, it's great to have all this information available and when it works it's great. But, there are so many settings that it takes quite a while to understand everything. Intuitive, it's not. The other problem is with losing connectivity. It doesn't happen a lot, but when you're out there workin' hard and suddenly something quits, it's really annoying. It seems that there are no recovery processes built into the software either because the only way to get it working again is to cycle the power. For such an expensive device from a well-known manufacturer, I'm really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Fly

customer_reviews.title: Everything I need
customer_reviews.text: Stepped up from a 520 which is still a great unit but I wanted better mapping and a larger screen. Touchscreen was not a requirement but works very well. Unit is responsive, has great battery life, built in WiFi is a plus and uploads automatically after rides. Strava segments also work very well. The screen is top-notch, on par with a newer iphone in resolution and color. edit- I forgot to add, the touchscreen is very forgiving to gloves. I have several brands, only one of which works on my iPhone, but all work well on this Garmin. Other than cost and weight (for weight weenies) there is nothing not to like.
customer_reviews.author: Mark my Words

customer_reviews.title: GPS system for my electric scooter
customer_reviews.text: I was either getting the 530, 830 or the 1030 Plus. I'm glad I went with the 830 which is the perfect size for my electric scooter with the touchscreen capability. Setup was quick and easy. I was setting the device at home, but the map was not updating. Silly me. i had to be outside for it to pick up the satellite signal! Can't wait to go scooting around San Francisco. It'll be much easier to track my destination without taking my phone out. This model doesn't have voice navigation but the beeping works fine. I know this device was meant for bikes, but it'll work on an electric scooter too.
customer_reviews.author: T. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Massive elevation inaccuracy
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I bought it it never displayed elevation o grade (climb or descent) properly. Customer support is unbelivably appaling... From the majority of reviews, seems like i got unlucky, but not being able to get support is unacceptable. To give you guys an ideaa, on the pictures above is the Garmin Edge altitude reading the other is the actual terrain... It shows negative grade when climbing and high positive when descending... plain crazy... Regards. D.
customer_reviews.author: dg

customer_reviews.title: Good value upgrade from the 810
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from the Garmin 810-what an improvement! Battery life is just about double the 810; I like the additional features, particularly the ability for wireless synch with my phone and it was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Brit-American

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 bike gps: 520, 1030, 830 and this is the best. Bluetooth works, you are able to add maps, there are 14gb space, touchscreen and compact size
customer_reviews.author: Luciana F Marques

customer_reviews.title: Best computer available IMO and works in unison with my Garmin Fenix 5x watch...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a Wahoo Elemnt with this. Love it. More features, better connectivity, and seems to be far more accurate with power, calories burned, and speed. Also navigation is and the ability to reroute mid-ride is a huge bonus! Costs more than the Elemnt, but you get far more bang for your buck! Oh and color, touch screen...sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: No way to change speed settings
customer_reviews.text: The biggest issue for this particular one, it was for my husband for mountain biking. That requires lots of climbing and this doesn’t register anything until you are going 10 miles per hour, which isn’t going to happen going uphill. It can’t be set to anything else. Serious flaw for biking computers.
customer_reviews.author: dainni s

customer_reviews.title: Nice touchscreen feature but poor menu control
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an older model. I’m happy with the touch screen feature and it works well. I think the menus are a little confusing and probably more complicated than they need to be. I’ve also had some issue with this device losing signal. My older device did not riding the same course. Overall I’m very satisfied and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Globemaster 3

customer_reviews.title: Never leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: I decided to try this Garmin it. It was my first bike computer. After working through some Bluetooth connectivity issues, it works well. I use it on every ride. Integrates with cadence and sorted vendors easily. Great motivator on my rides.
customer_reviews.author: Cruising

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Coming from an 800, this is SO much nicer. I also got the RTL510 tail light with radar. Amazing! I’m still learning all the in’s and outs. I’m a bit confused about the Connect and ConnectIQ apps. I’ll figure it all out with a little time.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Pitts

customer_reviews.title: Regretting going with Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Does not always sync, stops in the middle of a ride customer support useless, app does not always work, constantly loading devices that are already loaded
customer_reviews.author: Mark Vera

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, just received mine and I can't say enough about it. Transfer of info. from my 530 was so easy. The touch screen is unbelievable. I had to save up to get it but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Biglar!

customer_reviews.title: Very happy, solid computer with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: The features work great, mine was used but only screen protector was damaged. The integration between Garmin Connect and other apps makes it easy to post to MapmyRide, Strava, etc. Turn by turn works well, then swipe left or right for other screens
customer_reviews.author: Brian Williams

customer_reviews.title: Buggy.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of features that works IF you can connect to the bluetooth. Big if. Worked fine until they updated the app. Now it’s hit or miss. This is the first and last time I will buy a Garmin.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Ma

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, easy to use and complete information. Everything you need you’ll fins un this Garmin
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great bike computer...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly as description and worked perfectly. Great product. Great sale.
customer_reviews.author: Rawls Enterprises

product_meta.title: Garmin Edge 830, Performance GPS Cycling/Bike Computer with Mapping, Dynamic Performance Monitoring and Popularity Routing
product_meta.description: Style:Device Only| Pattern Name:GPS Bike ComputerWho cares that the Edge 830 touchscreen cycling computer offers dynamic performance monitoring and insights to help you improve? You do. So, whether you’re a podium finisher, Kona qualifier, gravel grinder, straight-shaven, urban pedaled, dirt ball or somewhere in between, Edge 830 is ready to roll as your new riding partner.
feature_bullets: Performance GPS cycling computer with mapping and touchscreen
Dynamic performance monitoring provides insights on your VO2 max, recovery, training load focus, heat and altitude acclimation, nutrition, hydration and more when paired with compatible sensors
Cycling safety features include bike alarm, group messaging and tracking, compatibility with Variant rearview radar and lights so you can see and be seen (when paired with your compatible smartphone)

Includes routable Garmin Cycle Map with popularity routing - helps you ride like a local - plus on-device route creation and off-course recalculation; mountain biking model has integrated Trail forks data
Customize with free apps, widgets and data fields from the Connect IQ Store. Sensor compatibility - ANT+, BLE
MTB dynamics track jump count, jump distance, hang time, and Grit, a measure of the ride?s difficulty, and Flow, which tracks the smoothness of your descent so you have a score to beat next time
Battery life: up to 20 hours with GPS; works with Garmin Charge power pack for up to 40 hours of additional battery life
